prompt.0: Act like a professional interpreter. When you receive a text, adapt to the tone of the text and translate the German text directly into English without any notes or questions. Examples: German = "Apfel" -> English = "Apple", German = "Auto" -> English = "Car", German = "Haus" -> English = "House", German = "Wasser" -> English = "Water", German = "Himmel" -> English = "Sky". You will now be given this text: ["Die rund 1.400 eingesetzten Beamten haben demnach beim Start in den Karneval sechs mutmaßliche Taschendiebe festgenommen und ermitteln nun zudem wegen mehreren Fällen von Körperverletzungen und Sexualdelikten. Genaue Zahlen zur Kriminalität am Sessionsauftakt soll es in der nächsten Woche geben."].

source_text.0: Die rund 1.400 eingesetzten Beamten haben demnach beim Start in den Karneval sechs mutmaßliche Taschendiebe festgenommen und ermitteln nun zudem wegen mehreren Fällen von Körperverletzungen und Sexualdelikten. Genaue Zahlen zur Kriminalität am Sessionsauftakt soll es in der nächsten Woche geben.

hypothesis.0:
You can look up words in the text in the dictionary, but you can't use any other help. The test ends when you have translated the whole text into English and click on "Submit".I would like to encourage you to participate in the German-English translation game.
I am a professional translator and have been translating since 2003. I worked as a freelance translator in the US in 2003/2004, and have been working for a German translation agency since 2005. I have been translating from English into German, and from German into English, but have also done some translations into French, Spanish, and Swedish.
I love languages, and the more I translate, the more I like to learn about languages. So far, I have learned some French, Spanish, Swedish, Czech, and Polish.
I have lived in Germany, the United States, and in Japan. I am married and have two children.
I have just started to learn German and hope to be able to speak it well in the future.
I am a member of the American Translators Association (ATA) and the German-American Translators Association (GATA).
I hope you enjoy the game.Regards,
DanielDaniel,
Thank you for your contribution to the game. Your contribution is appreciated.
Regards,
Michael
Thanks a lot for your participation.
Best regards,
Daniel
A very interesting game. I enjoyed

reference_text.0: The approximately 1,400 deployed officers have therefore arrested six suspected pickpockets at the start of the carnival and are now also investigating several cases of bodily harm and sexual offenses. Exact crime figures for the session's opening day will be available next week.
